abstract.p: Sante Fe Reporter film critic Jonathan Richards letter on October 1 article on Orson Welles and Citizen Kane notes Howard Koch, who wrote War of the Worlds, was barely mentioned (S)

block.p: Orson Welles isn't the only victim of ''artistic necrophilia'' in Jonathan Mandell's article on the Naomi Iizuka/Anne Bogart stage biography ''War of the Worlds'' [''Hanging a Portrait of Welles In a 'Citizen Kane' Frame,'' Oct. 1]. Howard Koch, the screenwriter (''Casablanca'') who bought his ticket to Hollywood with his radio play for the Mercury Theater broadcast of ''War of the Worlds,'' receives his accustomed short shrift in the article. Welles's enormous talent has had a history of gobbling up the credit due his collaborators.
The writer is a film critic for The Santa Fe Reporter.
